metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8630 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
The (1) kadm5_create_principal_3 and (2) kadm5_modify_principal functionsin lib/kadm5/srv/svr_principal.c in kadmind in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5)1.12.x and 1.13.x before 1.13.4 and 1.14.x before 1.14.1 allow remoteauthenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereferenceand daemon crash) by specifying KADM5_POLICY with a NULL policy name.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8630` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

krb5-admin-server - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
krb5-gss-samples - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
krb5-k5tls - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
krb5-kdc - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
krb5-kdc-ldap - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
krb5-kpropd - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
krb5-locales - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
krb5-multidev - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
krb5-otp - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
krb5-pkinit - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
krb5-user - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libgssapi-krb5-2 - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libgssrpc4 - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libk5crypto3 - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libkadm5clnt-mit11 - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libkadm5srv-mit11 - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libkdb5-8 - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libkrad0 - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libkrb5-3 - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libkrb5support0 - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: krb5 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1').
